snippet: Among her proposals, Christine C. Quinn, the Council speaker, said she would replace textbooks with computer tablets and reduce the emphasis on testing.
abstract: Christine C Quinn, New York City Council speaker and presumptive candidate for mayor, lays out series of proposals for improving the city’s schools, including replacing textbooks with computer tablets; also  proposes reducing  emphasis on testing and taking a less punitive approach to struggling schools.
lead_paragraph: Among her proposals, Christine C. Quinn, the Council speaker, said she would replace textbooks with computer tablets and reduce the emphasis on testing.

headline.seo: Christine C. Quinn Presents Her Vision for Improving N.Y.C. Schools
headline.main: Quinn Presents Vision for Improving New York City Schools
headline.print_headline: Quinn Presents Vision for Improving New York City Schools
